comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: Francis ("Frank") Davis Millet (1846-1912) was an American painter, sculptor, and writer. He perished on the Titanic, April 15, 1912. Mark Twain was the best man at his wedding in 1879. He is credited with inventing spray paint at the World's Columbian Exposition in Chicago in 1893, where he served as decorations director. – Wikipedia The Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution, has an online collection of Francis Davis Millet and Millet family papers.

comment.author: 9232091@N03
comment._content:
Millet was also a Civil War drummer boy and later in life commissioned by the United States to design a number of military service medals including  the Civil War, Spanish American War,  Indian Wars, Philippine Campaign  and many more.

Artist, Author, War Correspondent, Harvard graduate... he was one of the most famous men on the Titanic.

comment._content: When I saw this beautiful photograph it inspired me to use it for a new collage, a true story came up and I decided to deal with it permanently If you are interested you can take a look here www.flickr.com/photos/carolinetamtama/4063565209/. Thanks for adding this photo to The Commons
